data.title: Countries that use the Arabic dirham
data.meta_description: Usage and exchange rates of the Arabic dirham. Convert AED to any other currency.
data.text:
The Arabic dirham was established in 1971 as an official national currency and is used only in the United Arab Emirates. 1 Dirham is devided into 100 Fils.

The Arabic dirham is tied to the US dollar with a fixed exchange rate. Therefore, 1 dirham always equals to 0.2723 US dollar.

ISO 4127:

AED

Numeric:

784

Symbol:

Dh

List of all currencies

Overview: United Arab Emirates

1.00 Arabic dirhams = 0.27 US dollars

Currency:

Convert to:

Amount:

↔ Reverse currencies

Exchange rate history 1 AED in USD

The two currencies are directly interdependent and have a fixed conversion rate.

› Inflation development in the United Arab Emirates

Currency reserves for the Arabic dirham

According to the International Monetary Fund, the total broad money (M3) amounted to AED 2.023 trillion at the end of 2023. For currency hedging, reserves were held in a total amount of 695.91 billion dirhams. This corresponds to a ratio of 1:2.9. Or in other words, 10 of 29 dirhams are deposited with a countervalue, which is internationally already above average.

› Worldwide currency and gold reserves

Sources

All conversion rates are based on data from the European Central Bank.

Data on currency and gold reserves are from the International Monetary Fund.
